dt: {bc}a typically cylindrical vessel for catching, holding, or carrying liquids or solids
{bc}one of the receptacles on the rim of a waterwheel
{bc}one of the cups of an endless-belt conveyor
{bc}one of the vanes of a turbine rotor

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}buket{/it}, from Old English {it}būc{/it} pitcher, belly; akin to Old High German {it}būh{/it} belly
shortdef: a typically cylindrical vessel for catching, holding, or carrying liquids or solids
something resembling a bucket: such as
the scoop of an excavating machine

dt: {bc}to deal with in a bucket shop

dt.t: It doesn't just rain here. It pours; it lashes; it {wi}buckets{/wi}.
Rain {wi}bucketed down{/wi} for the next two days …

shortdef: to draw or lift in buckets

dt: {bc}a chain of persons acting to put out a fire by passing buckets of water from hand to hand

shortdef: a chain of persons acting to put out a fire by passing buckets of water from hand to hand

dt: {bc}a cloth hat (as of canvas or twill) with a downward-sloping brim and a soft circular crown

dt.t: … to me there is nothing more intimidating than wearing a {wi}bucket hat{/wi}. That brimmed shape—always tight fitted to the head—reminds me of hats I'd wear as a kid.

shortdef: a cloth hat (as of canvas or twill) with a downward-sloping brim and a soft circular crown

dt: {bc}a list of things that one has not done before but wants to do before dying

et: from the phrase {it}kick the bucket{/it} (to die)
shortdef: a list of things that one has not done before but wants to do before dying

dt: {bc}a low, separate, usually contoured seat for one person (as in an automobile or an airplane) {dx}compare {dxt|bench seat||}{/dx}

shortdef: a low, separate, usually contoured seat for one person (as in an automobile or an airplane)

dt: {bc}a saloon in which liquor was formerly sold from or dispensed in open containers (such as buckets or pitchers)
{bc}a gambling establishment that formerly used market fluctuations (as in securities or commodities) as a basis for gaming
{bc}one that formerly failed to execute customers' margin orders in expectation of making a profit from market fluctuations adverse to the customers' interests

shortdef: a saloon in which liquor was formerly sold from or dispensed in open containers (such as buckets or pitchers)
a gambling establishment that formerly used market fluctuations (as in securities or commodities) as a basis for gaming
a dishonest brokerage firm; especially : one that formerly failed to execute customers' margin orders in expectation of making a profit from market fluctuations adverse to the customers' interests

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or possessing working-class values {bc}{sx|blue-collar||}

shortdef: of, relating to, or possessing working-class values : blue-collar
